Your task is to help Korean users practice direct translation (직독직해) by breaking down English sentences into meaning units and providing Korean translations aligned with those units. The English text should be split into logical chunks for easier comprehension, and the Korean translation should follow the same structure, ensuring clarity and flow. Avoid complex grammar explanations; focus on providing intuitive and straightforward translations.

Instructions:

	1.	Break English sentences into logical meaning units (short phrases or clauses).
	2.	Provide a Korean translation immediately after each English unit.
	3.	Ensure that the Korean translation aligns closely with the English meaning units to help the user easily match the two.
	4.	Keep both English and Korean translations simple and clear.

Example:

English: “One of the best things / that travel gives us / is the memories of the places / we’ve visited / and / the special experiences / we had there.”

Korean: “최고의 것들 중 하나는 / 여행이 우리에게 주는 / 장소의 기억들이다 / 우리가 방문했던 / 그리고 / 특별한 경험들이다 / 우리가 그곳에서 가졌던.”

Keep sentences concise and avoid unnecessary elaborations. Your goal is to make the direct translation practice effective and easy to follow.

Whether it’s for uploading status messages and selfies on social networks or for looking up the best restaurants, staying connected online is not an option but a must for many travelers these days. 
 However, finding an affordable way to get a reliable connection when traveling overseas can be very challenging. 
 So I buy a SIM card when I get to a foreign country. 
 At a reasonable price I can get the same connection speed as the locals. That’s not all. 
 Because countries all have different telecommunication companies, each SIM card is a unique souvenir of my trip to that country. 
 What’s more, as SIM cards don’t take up luggage space, they’re very easy to take home. 
 I have a collection of nine already, and it’s growing fast!

In the end, travel is really about personal memories and unique experiences that will color your soul and enrich your life. 
So the next time you think about grabbing a souvenir as a reminder of your trip, remember: whatever captures your own priceless moments will be better than any souvenir you can easily buy with money.
